baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The center earns a moderate score due to its excellent internal financial management and high program spending, balanced against a lack of external impact verification and a specific religious-cultural focus.

Lower alignment for donors seeking high-urgency humanitarian relief versus local religious infrastructure.

dimension_explanations.alignment: The center provides a specialized fit for donors interested in local religious and cultural infrastructure, though its focus on community-building results in lower urgency compared to global humanitarian causes [1][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates strong financial health and capacity building, allocating an 89.9% program expense ratio toward its mission [2]. While it holds 26.3 months of working capital, there is limited publicly available evidence regarding specific beneficiary outcomes [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Center of Irvine Inc serves as a comprehensive community hub dedicated to promoting Islamic values and excellence through diverse social and professional programming.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 89.9% ensures the vast majority of funds go directly to community services [2].
Exceptional fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised [1].
Strong liquidity with 26.3 months of working capital available [2].
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Center of Irvine Inc is a religious organization that reported a total revenue of $2,209,994 in its most recent fiscal filings [2]. The center operates key initiatives such as The Village In Irvine and the ICOI Young Professionals to address the spiritual and social needs of its community [1].

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value local community infrastructure and want to support a financially stable, efficient religious center in Southern California.
donor_motivations: Want to support local Islamic social and professional networking
Value high financial efficiency and zero fundraising costs
Prefer investing in long-term community stability over emergency relief
giving_considerations: Donations are for sadaqah and general operations, not zakat
The organization has very high cash reserves
Impact is measured through community presence rather than formal metrics
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fulfill zakat obligations or those requiring rigorous academic evidence of social outcomes.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects efficient spending but a lack of <cite id="14">formal outcome measurement or external evaluations</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization creates impact by providing a physical and social space for religious practice and community development.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that community programs are effectively meeting the spiritual and social needs of the Irvine Muslim population.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the center has <cite id="9">significant reserves</cite>, its <cite id="13">10.6% revenue growth</cite> suggests expanding community needs.

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="4">89.9% of its total expenses</cite> toward its core community and religious programs.
ICOI reports a <cite id="5">fundraising cost of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>, maximizing the impact of every dollar donated.
The center maintains <cite id="9">26.3 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant long-term stability.

strengths_deep_dive: The Islamic Center of Irvine demonstrates a strong commitment to financial transparency and operational leaneness. By maintaining <cite id="10">100% independent board members</cite>, the organization ensures objective oversight of its <cite id="11">$4.87 million in total assets</cite>. Its revenue model is diversified, including <cite id="12">$206,424 in program service revenue</cite> alongside traditional donations, which supports its <cite id="13">3-year revenue CAGR of 10.6%</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Islamic Center of Irvine Inc (ICOI) serves as a vital community hub in Orange County, California, dedicated to promoting Islamic values through social and professional programming. In the 2022 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="1">total revenue of $2,209,994</cite>, primarily driven by <cite id="2">$1,944,081 in public contributions</cite>. The center distinguishes itself through a diverse array of services, including <cite id="3">The Village In Irvine and ICOI Young Professionals</cite>, which cater to specific demographic needs within the local Muslim community. Financially, the organization demonstrates high efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 89.9%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of funds support direct community services. Furthermore, ICOI exhibits <cite id="5">exceptional fundraising efficiency</cite>, spending $0.00 to raise every $1 in donations. While the organization is <cite id="6">not fully rated by Charity Navigator</cite>, it maintains strong internal governance with a <cite id="7">board of 9 independent members</cite>. The center also engages in targeted philanthropy, providing <cite id="8">$31,500 in domestic grants</cite> to other Islamic institutions, reinforcing its role as a pillar of regional religious infrastructure.
